newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Centennial up 16.39 pct in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Centennial up 16.39 pct in late trade.

text.p: Centennial City Inc surged 50 centavos, or 16.39 percent, to 3.55 pesos in late trade on Wednesday on talks that a land deal in which it was involved had been cleared of charges of irregularities, brokers said.

"There's this rumour that the committee has decided to exonerate the consortium and people may have been convinced by it considering the sharp rise of City," said Noel Reyes, research head at Anscor Hagedorn Securities.
Centennial has a 20 percent interest in the Thai-Philippine Amari consortium which has proposed to undertake a 750-hectare reclamation project in Manila Bay.
The deal came under a cloud last December when a Senator said the lease rent to be paid to the government was lower than market prices.
On Wednesday, the Philippine Star newspaper reported that a Cabinet committee formed by President Fidel Ramos to investigate the deal had found no evidence to back charges of bribery.
Guoco Holdings (Philippines) Inc, a unit of Hong Kong's Guoco Group Ltd, which is also involved in the Manila Bay project also posted gains. Centennial is an affiliate of Guoco Holdings.
Guoco was up 45 centavos, or 9.47 percent, at 5.20 pesos in late trade.
Centennial was the third most actively traded issue with total volume at 68.24 million shares while 10.91 million Guoco shares were traded just before the session's close.
